Pre-Game Insights: Zambia are still chasing their first win in the tournament since their 2012 triumph.
Zambia were reduced to ten men after Rodrick Kabwe received a second yellow card.
Zambia salvaged a point through Patson Daka's powerful late header.
Morocco are targeting their second AFCON title in history.
Morocco's Achraf Hakimi got his side off to a flying start with an opening goal in the sixth minute.
Silas Katompa Mvumpa of Congo DR snatched a deserved equaliser for DR Congo in the 76th minute.
There was a melee between players and coaching staff from both sides after the final whistle.
Zambia will be without Kabwe, who will serve a one-match suspension for his dismissal against Tanzania, and he is expected to be replaced by Tandi Mwape in the starting lineup.
Clatous Chama is in contention for a starting berth after putting in a fine showing last time out, providing the assist for Daka's equaliser.
Sofiane Boufal for Abde Ezzalzouli was the only change made by Regragui from Morocco's opener, and he could stick with the same lineup from the draw with Congo DR.
Noussair Mazraoui is yet to feature in this tournament, and he remains a doubt.
Youssef En-Nesyri, who netted in the victory over Tanzania, is likely to spearhead the attack once more on Wednesday.
